isis.stitle: Recall 00514 - NON-COMPLIANCE RECALL - Changing manual slack adjusters to automatic slack adjusters on 4700 models built from 1/6/95 through 4/28/95 with export code 10520

recall.subject: NON-COMPLIANCE RECALL - Changing manual slack adjusters to automatic slack adjusters on 4700 models built from 1/6/95 through 4/28/95 with export code 10520

important.para: Due to the size of this campaign (40 vehicles), only the nearest servicing dealers (see Table 2) were notified of this recall. ZIP codes were used to find the nearest servicing dealer for each customer. Review the customer address(s) listed for your dealership ( Table 2) and if you are not the nearest servicing dealer, forward this information to the nearest servicing dealer.

defect.para: This defect involves the manual slack adjusters on the braking system. Code 10520 is an export code that allowed manual slack adjusters to be installed on these vehicles. Federal Motor Vehicle Safety Standard 121 requires that all service brakes be self-adjusting with automatic slack adjusters built after 10/24/94. Vehicles built with manual slack adjusters do not satisfy this requirement. This non-compliance must be corrected in accordance with this letter, in order to be in compliance with Federal Motor Vehicle Safety Standards.
This Non-compliance Recall involves only 4700 4X2 models built from 1/6/95 through 4/28/95 with export code 10520.

ownernote.para: International Truck and Engine Corporation will notify owners of these vehicles about this campaign. During the recall process, a listing of owner names and addresses will be furnished to the involved dealers to enable dealers to follow up with owners and have the vehicles corrected. You must limit the use of this listing to this campaign since the list may contain information obtained from state motor vehicle registration records and the use of such motor vehicle registration data for purposes other than this campaign is a violation of law in several states.

step1.para: Park the vehicle on level ground, put the transmission in neutral, set the parking brake and shut off the engine.

warning.para: Block the wheels to prevent the vehicle from moving in both directions. If the vehicle rolls unexpectedly, the result could be serious personal injury or death.

step1.para: After blocking the wheels, release the parking brake.

warning.para: Do not work under a vehicle supported only by jacks. Jacks can slip or fall over and cause injury.

step1.para: If necessary to raise the vehicle in order to remove the slack adjusters, support the vehicle with safety stands.
Cage the parking brake spring so that the service brake is completely released.
Use a wrench to turn the manual adjusting nut in the direction to move the slack adjuster away from the clevis.
Remove the snap ring and washers from the brake camshaft or the powershaft. Remove the slack adjuster from the camshaft.
Loosen the jam nut and remove the clevis from the push rod.
Use this procedure to remove all four slack adjusters.
Lubricate the splines on the slack adjuster gear and the splines on the camshaft with anti-seize compound.
With the spring in the caged position, install the new clevis on the push rod so the measurement from the mounting surface of the chamber to the center of the large clevis hole is 2.75 inches.

note.para: The slack adjusters have lubrication holes in the gear splines and operating the actuator before installation may pump grease through the holes causing a messy condition and depleting the grease in the slack adjuster.

The pawl assembly can be on either side of the housing or on the front of the housing. Make sure the pawl assembly can be removed after the slack adjuster is installed. The pawl assembly must sometimes be removed when the slack adjuster is serviced. The pawl must be facing inward towards the center of the chassis. Reference Table 1 in the "PARTS INFORMATION" section for the right slack adjuster part number for each wheel end.

step1.para: Install the slack adjuster on the camshaft or the powershaft.

Install spacing washers and the snap ring until there is a maximum clearance of 0.062 inch between the washer(s) and the snap ring. If the clearance is greater than 0.062 inch, shim with additional washer(s) until clearance is less than 0.062 inch.
Remove the pawl assembly from the slack adjuster.

caution.para: If you do not remove the pawl, you will damage the teeth when you turn the manual adjusting nut in step 9.

step1.para: Use a wrench to turn the manual-adjusting nut to align the hole in the arm of the slack adjuster with the large hole in the clevis.

Apply anti-seize compound to the two clevis pins. Check again to make sure that the clevis is installed in the correct position. Adjust the clevis if necessary. Install the clevis pin, install the clip to hold the clevis pin in place and hold the clevis while tightening the jam nut against the clevis.
Re-install the adjusting pawl and tighten the retaining nut to 15-20 ft-lbs.
Use this procedure to install all four slack adjusters.

warning.para: Start the vehicle, build up air system pressure, and apply the service brakes a few times to verify brake actuation before attempting to move the vehicle.

partsinfo.para: Order the following parts and quantities for each vehicle in this campaign.

table.title: Parts Required for Each Vehicle in This Campaign

entry.para: Front Left, Meritor auto slack adjuster
Front Right, Meritor auto slack adjuster
Rear Right, Meritor auto slack adjuster
Rear Left, Meritor auto slack adjuster

partsinfo.para: Due to the size of this campaign (40 vehicles), only the nearest servicing dealers (below) were notified of this recall. ZIP codes were used to find the nearest servicing dealer for each customer. Review the customer address(s) listed for your dealership and if you are not the nearest servicing dealer, forward this information to the nearest servicing dealer.

table.title: Customer Addresses and Nearest Servicing Dealers

para.emph: NOTE: There are forty vehicles in this campaign and all of them will require this procedure. Only one labor operation is required for this campaign.

responuscan.para:
Proceed immediately to make necessary correction to units in inventory. All inventory vehicles subject to this recall campaign must be corrected prior to sale, transfer or delivery.
If vehicles have been sold or transferred and you are in receipt of Customer Notification Letters and Authorization for Recall Service cards for those vehicles, transfer location or customer must be notified IMMEDIATELY from your dealer location.
Dealers must correct all vehicles subject to this campaign at no charge to the owner, regardless of mileage, age of vehicle, or ownership, from this time forward.

The National Traffic and Motor Vehicle Safety Act, as amended, provides that each vehicle that is subject to a vehicle recall campaign must be adequately repaired within a reasonable time after the owner has tendered it for repair. A failure to adequately repair within 60 days after a tender of a vehicle is prima facie evidence of failure to repair within a reasonable time. If the condition is not adequately repaired within 60 days, the owner may be entitled to replacement with an identical or reasonable equivalent vehicle at no charge, or to a refund of the purchase price less a reasonable allowance for depreciation.
However, consistent with the customer notification, dealers are expected to complete the repairs on the mutually agreed upon service date.

In order to avoid having to replace an owner vehicle or refund the purchase price, every effort must be made to promptly schedule an appointment with each owner to repair his or her vehicle as soon as possible.

claims.para: Refer to Dealer Warranty Manual for procedures to conduct Recall Campaigns.

It is important that the Recall Coding be completed properly to assist in processing the warranty claim. Complete instructions will be found in the Warranty Manual, Section 7-1. Special attention should be given to Items 39 through 44:

responex.para: Proceed immediately to make necessary correction to units in inventory. All inventory vehicles subject to this recall campaign must be corrected prior to sale, transfer or delivery. If vehicles have been sold or transferred and you are in receipt of Customer Notification Letters and Authorization for Recall Service cards for those vehicles, transfer location or customer must be notified from your distributor location.
We ask for your full cooperation and follow-up to this important subject matter.
